results.title: Computer revolution. Parts 1 and 2
results.creator_credit: James Jackson, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
A timely - even frightening - reminder of the rapid advance computers are making into our lives. In many fields the impersonal efficient machine is shaping and controlling our destinies. The film points to the ever-increasing reliance on computers and illustrates computer applications of today and in the future specifically in production, aviation, medicine, education, law-enforcement, rocket space travel, design, communication etc. Implications for citizens’ rights to privacy. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Cities of the future
results.creator_credit: Gordon Hyatt, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Discusses radical approaches to town planning, showing various concepts. The totally planned new city, Brasilia; incorporation of historic elements as in Philadelphia; pedestrian areas in Miami and Montreal; planned residential extensions; and suggested new construction methods. Exciting architectural ideas include: weather-proofed cities, mega-structures surrounded by green-belts, multi-level cities and floating cities. Features some animated scenes. Narrated by Walter Cronkite and animated by John Hubley.

results.title: The Food revolution
results.creator_credit: James Jackson, Burton Benjamin, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Explains some of the pilot projects on which scientists are working as they attempt to cope with the problems of food shortage and exploding population in the 21st century. At least one and a half million people are being damaged in body and in mind because they do not have enough to eat. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Fighting fear with fear
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Burton Benjamin, Isaac Kleinerman and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Neurotic behaviour is just a bad habit that can be unlearned. This is the basis of a contronversial psychotherapeutic technique developed by Drs Thomas Stampfi and Donald Lewis. In the film, a 23 year-old secretary is treated with a bombardment of the terrifying situation she fears most. According to Stampfi and Lewis, facing fear head-on breaks down the neurosis so she can relearn what may make her happiest.

results.title: Medical electronics
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Donald, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Shows how technology is helping doctors in the three problem areas of time, training and techniques. The use of electronic diagnostic equipment and information retrieval systems, the training methods which allow students to practice on mock-ups of a patient can now overcome many problems. Fibre optics, pressurized operating rooms, and freezing of diseased tissue are among the many treatment techniques described. Narrated by Walter Cronkite.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jonathan Donald, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News

results.title: Industries of the future
results.creator_credit: David Tapper, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Considers the course of industry, technology and invention during the coming century. Examines the kind of innovations that will shape the civilisation of the future. Studies the opportunities and changes that will arise from the development of an industrially and scientifically oriented society. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: New weapons against crime
results.creator_credit: Norton Bloom, Burton Benjamin and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Demonstrates the application of modern technology to combat crime. Shows uses of computers, voice prints, olefactronics to identify odours, video tape to record crimes, electronic eavesdropping devices, and chemicals to restrain violence.

results.title: The Human heart
results.creator_credit: Isaac Kleinerman, James Jackson and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Dr. Christiaan Barnard and other eminent heart surgeons demonstrate the latest techniques for treatment and possible prevention of heart disease. Probable new developments are discussed. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Isaac Kleinerman, James Jackson and CBS News

results.title: A Trip from Chicago
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”
Discusses ideas for advanced forms of public transport over varying distances of hundreds or thousands of miles. High-speed ground vehicles using rocket power and roller bearings, sealed tubes or air-cushion support, vertical takeoff aircraft, jets and rockets are discussed with their designers and prototypes are demonstrated. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.
results.description:

results.title: Jonas Salk: science of life
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS Network
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Dr Jonas Salk, at his Institute for Biological Studies, is seeking ways to fuse the two disciplines of the scientist and humanist. It is vital for scientists and humanists to work together, he claims, ‘to make the decisions and choices that nature has made until now…for the greatest value to human life and society as a whole’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS Network
